meanings.definition: A bundle of sticks or twigs bound together for use as fuel.
meanings.sent1: The faix of firewood was neatly stacked by the fireplace.
meanings.sent2: She carried a heavy faix of branches on her back.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel built its nest using a faix of twigs.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a faix of sticks, easily broken and forgotten.
meanings.sent5: The faix of kindling crackled and popped in the campfire.

meanings.definition: A group or collection of things.
meanings.sent1: The faix of books on the shelf caught her eye.
meanings.sent2: The faix of colorful balloons floated in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The faix of toys in the playroom seemed endless.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were a tangled faix of memories and dreams.
meanings.sent5: The faix of clouds in the sky created a beautiful sunset.

meanings.definition: To gather or collect into a bundle or group.
meanings.sent1: She would faix the flowers into a lovely bouquet.
meanings.sent2: He decided to faix all his tools in one toolbox.
meanings.sent3: The children would faix their toys before bedtime.
meanings.sent4: The team needed to faix their ideas for the presentation.
meanings.sent5: She would faix her hair into a neat bun before work.
